bibl.title: Cinna and Euphorion.
bibl.note: Euphorion belonged to that class of poets who "vocibus magis quam rebus inserviunt" (Cic., Or. 68), and it was for imitation of this vitium that Cicero attacked Euphorion's latter-day inheritors, of whom he accounted Cinna the leading spirit.
bibl.seg: Watson Lindsay C., Cinna and Euphorion.

Euphorion belonged to that class of poets who "vocibus magis quam rebus inserviunt" (Cic., Or. 68), and it was for imitation of this vitium that Cicero attacked Euphorion's latter-day inheritors, of whom he accounted Cinna the leading spirit.
